guards.name: Closed Guard
guards.description: The closed guard is one of the fundamental positions in Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu. It involves wrapping your legs around your opponent's waist while lying on your back, creating a tight control that prevents them from passing.
execution: Lie on your back with your opponent between your legs
Lock your ankles behind their back
Use your legs to break their posture by pulling them down
Control their sleeves or collar with your hands
Keep your hips active and mobile
cons: Can be difficult against standing opponents
Limited mobility compared to open guards
tips: Always break your opponent's posture first
Use angle changes to create submission opportunities
Don't let your opponent establish a strong base
Practice hip escapes to maintain the guard

guards.name: Spider Guard
guards.description: Spider guard is an open guard position where you control your opponent's sleeves while placing your feet on their biceps or inside their elbows, creating distance and controlling their posture.
execution: Start from open guard position
Grab both of your opponent's sleeves
Place your feet on their biceps, pushing them away
Extend your legs to create tension
Use one foot to control the hip if doing single spider
Keep constant pressure and movement
pros: Allows for transitions to other guards
cons: Can be passed with good balance
Difficult against standing leg drag passes
tips: Always maintain sleeve grips
Combine with lasso or collar guards
Keep your opponent off balance
Use bicep control to prevent them standing tall

sweeps.name: Spider Sweep
sweeps.description: Push with one leg while pulling with grips to sweep opponent to the side.

guards.name: De La Riva Guard
guards.description: The De La Riva guard is named after Ricardo De La Riva. It involves hooking your opponent's leg from the outside with your leg while controlling their opposite sleeve, creating an asymmetrical control position.
execution: From open guard, identify opponent's lead leg
Hook your outside leg behind their near leg
Wrap your foot around to their inner thigh
Grip their opposite collar or sleeve
Use your other leg to control their hip or bicep
Stay active and create angles
pros: Great for transitioning to other guards
cons: Can be countered by backstep passes
Vulnerable to knee slice if not maintained
tips: Keep constant tension on the hook
Combine with berimbolo attacks
Control the far sleeve to prevent defense
Practice inversions for advanced attacks

sweeps.name: De La Riva Sweep
sweeps.description: Use the hook and far grip to off-balance and sweep.

sweeps.name: Berimbolo

sweeps.name: Balloon Sweep

guards.name: Butterfly Guard ðŸ¦‹
guards.description: Butterfly guard is a seated guard where you use hooks under your opponent's legs while sitting up, allowing for dynamic sweeps and transitions.
execution: Sit with your knees bent and feet inside
Place your feet (hooks) under opponent's thighs
Control their upper body with collar/sleeve grips
Keep your chest close to theirs
Stay on your toes ready to elevate
Use underhooks when possible
pros: Works in both Gi and No-Gi
cons: Can be smashed by heavy pressure
tips: Get underhooks whenever possible
Elevate and off-balance constantly
Combine with half guard transitions
Practice the butterfly sweep mechanics

sweeps.name: Butterfly Sweep
sweeps.description: Elevate with hooks while pulling opponent forward to sweep.

sweeps.name: Arm Drag Sweep
sweeps.description: Use arm drag to take the back or sweep.

sweeps.name: Hook Sweep

guards.name: X Guard
guards.description: X-guard is an inverted position where your legs form an 'X' shape to control your opponent's legs and balance, typically used for sweeps and transitions.
execution: Start from a seated or inverted position
Place one leg across opponent's lower back/hip
Hook your other leg under their near leg
Grab their ankle or pant leg
Your legs should form an 'X' shape
Control their posture and balance
tips: Keep constant pressure with your legs
Combine with single leg X transitions
Practice the basic X-guard sweep first
Use it to stand up safely

sweeps.name: X-Guard Sweep
sweeps.description: Elevate opponent with X configuration and sweep.

sweeps.name: Technical Stand
sweeps.description: Use X-guard to safely stand up and sweep.

sweeps.name: Leg Drag Counter

passes.name: Leg Weave Pass

passes.name: Pressure Pass
passes.description: Apply heavy pressure to flatten the X-guard.

submissions.name: Straight Ankle Lock
submissions.description: Attack the ankle from X-guard position.

guards.name: Half Guard
guards.description: Half guard is a position where you control one of your opponent's legs between yours while on your back, offering both defensive recovery and offensive opportunities.
execution: Trap one of opponent's legs between yours
Get on your side, don't stay flat
Use an underhook on their trapped side
Frame with your other hand against their shoulder
Keep your bottom leg locked around theirs
Create space with your frames
pros: Can transition to deep half or lockdown
cons: Can be smashed with good pressure
tips: Never stay flat on your back
Get the underhook as priority
Use knee shield variation for distance
Practice the old school sweep
